name: Rocq Basics
description: Learn the fundamentals of Rocq syntax and proof structure

levels.name: Welcome to Rocq
levels.objective: Type 'Check nat.' and see what Rocq responds

theory.markdown:
# Welcome to Rocq!

Rocq (formerly Coq) is a proof assistant that helps you write mathematical proofs.

## The Check Command

The `Check` command tells you the type of any expression.

Try typing: `Check nat.`

examples.title: Checking functions
examples.code:
Check (fun x : nat => x).
(* fun x : nat => x : nat -> nat *)

hints: Type 'Check' followed by what you want to check
The exact answer is: Check nat.

levels.name: Definitions
levels.objective: Define a constant called 'five' equal to the number 5

theory.markdown:
# Definitions

You can define constants using the `Definition` keyword.

## Syntax

```
Definition name : type := value.
```

examples.title: Simple definition
examples.code:
Definition three : nat := 3.
Check three.
(* three : nat *)

hints: The syntax is: Definition name : type := value.

levels.name: Your First Theorem
levels.objective: State a theorem that nat is a Type

theory.markdown:
# Theorems

Theorems are statements we want to prove.

## Syntax

```
Theorem name : statement.
```

We'll prove it in the next level!

levels.startingCode: (* State a theorem that nat is a Type *)

levels.name: Proof Structure
levels.objective: Start and end a proof (we'll fill it in next)

theory.markdown:
# Proof Structure

Every proof has the same structure:

```
Theorem name : statement.
Proof.
  (* proof steps here *)
Qed.
```

- `Proof.` starts the proof
- `Qed.` ends the proof (after it's complete)

levels.startingCode:
Theorem nat_is_type : Type.
(* Add Proof. and Qed. with tactics between them *)
levels.solution:
Theorem nat_is_type : Type.
Proof.
  exact nat.
Qed.
hints: You need a tactic in between (use 'exact nat.')

levels.name: The Exact Tactic
levels.objective: Use 'exact' to prove nat is a Type

theory.markdown:
# The exact Tactic

The `exact` tactic provides a proof term directly.

## Syntax

```
exact term.
```

If `term` has exactly the type you need to prove, you're done!

examples.title: Using exact
examples.code:
Theorem example : nat.
Proof.
  exact 42.
Qed.

levels.startingCode:
Theorem nat_is_type : Type.
Proof.
  (* Use exact here *)
Qed.
levels.solution:
Theorem nat_is_type : Type.
Proof.
  exact nat.
Qed.
hints: You need to provide something that has type 'Type'

levels.name: Comments
levels.objective: Add a comment to your proof

theory.markdown:
# Comments

Comments help document your code.

## Syntax

```
(* This is a comment *)
```

Comments are ignored by Rocq but help humans understand your code!

examples.title: Using comments
examples.code:
(* This theorem shows nat is a Type *)
Theorem nat_is_type : Type.
Proof.
  (* Just provide nat directly *)
  exact nat.
Qed.

levels.startingCode:
Theorem nat_is_type : Type.
Proof.
  exact nat.
Qed.

(* Add a comment above explaining what this proves *)
levels.solution:
(* nat is a Type *)
Theorem nat_is_type : Type.
Proof.
  exact nat.
Qed.
hints: Put a comment above the Theorem line
Any comment works - just add (* your text *)

levels.name: Tutorial Complete!
levels.description: You're ready for the real challenges

theory.markdown:
# Congratulations!

You've learned:
- The Check command
- How to define constants
- How to state theorems
- Proof structure (Proof...Qed)
- The exact tactic
- Comments

Now let's prove something more interesting: that function types exist!

levels.startingCode:
(* Prove that the function type nat -> nat exists *)
Theorem function_type_exists : Type.
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Qed.
levels.solution:
Theorem function_type_exists : Type.
Proof.
  exact (nat -> nat).
Qed.
hints: Function types use the arrow: A -> B
You need to provide a function type
